meanings.definition: To convert (a substance) into a gelatinous form.
meanings.sent1: She pectized the mixture by adding a thickening agent.
meanings.sent2: The chef pectized the fruit puree to create a smooth dessert.
meanings.sent3: The science experiment went wrong when the student pectized the solution too quickly.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush pectized the colors on the canvas, creating a beautiful blend.
meanings.sent5: The warm water slowly pectized the powdered gelatin, turning it into a wobbly treat.

meanings.sent2: Adding the right amount of sugar will pectize the jam perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved pectizing a liquid into a solid in seconds.
